body_content.explanation: the act of someone taking part in a video conference (= a meeting at which two or more people who are in different places can talk to and see each other using electronic technology) to which they have not been invited, often with the intention of interrupting and annoying the people in the meeting:
examples: Zoombombing, a kind of virtual gatecrashing that has been used to spread harassment and hate speech, has become a serious problem during the pandemic.
Zoom announced security enhancements designed to help meeting hosts block zoombombing attempts.
